content: cobblestone stitch dishcloth pattern crochet pattern by josie anderson from firstthecoffee com connect on social & links ravelry etsy crochet pattern | firstthecoffee com copyright the crochet pattern and photographs contained in this document are the property of first the coffee no unauthorized reproduction or distribution of this pattern in whole or in part is permitted you can sell your finished items made using my patterns but please credit firstthecoffee com notes ● this crochet pattern is written in us terms ● if you want to change the size of this crocheted dishcloth the foundation chain needs to be an odd number ● this pattern is mostly a repeat of 2 row alternating each row ● initial chains in a row do not count as a stitch ● the finished size is 9 inches wide x 9 inches tall materials ● 93 yards of a medium-weight #4 cotton yarn ● 4 5 mm 7 crochet hook ● yarn needle to weave in ends ● stitch markers optional ● scissors crochet abbreviations used us terms ● chain chain ● single_crochet single_crochet ● sl slip_stitch ● half_double_crochet half_double_crochet crochet pattern | firstthecoffee com pattern foundation chain 34 turn row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet all the way across in each chain 33 stitches row 2 chain 1 turn half_double_crochet in first single_crochet * sl in next stitch half_double_crochet in next stitch repeat from * all across 33 stitches last stitch in the row should be a half_double_crochet row 3 chain 1 turn single_crochet in 1st stitch single_crochet all the way across in each stitch turn 33 stitches row 4 repeat row 2 row 5 repeat row 3 row 6 repeat row 2 row 7-11 repeat row 3 row 12 30 repeat row 2 on the even-numbered row 12 14 16 etc and repeat row 3 on odd-numbered row 13 15 17 etc row 31 35 repeat row 3 row 36 - 41 repeat row 2 on the even-numbered row and repeat row 3 on odd-numbered row fasten_off and weave in ends blocking is optional and may be required to obtain a perfect square shape crochet pattern | firstthecoffee com
